title: 111_hr3256
content: The Act titled "Rural Community Hospital Demonstration Extension Act of 2009" extends the Rural Community Hospital Demonstration Program. The Rural Community Hospital Demonstration Program is extended for an additional 5-year period, allowing for expansion into rural areas in any State and an increase in the maximum number of participating hospitals. During the 5-year extension period of the Rural Community Hospital Demonstration Program, up to 30 rural community hospitals can participate. Existing hospitals in the program can continue their participation unless they choose otherwise. During the 5-year extension period of the Rural Community Hospital Demonstration Program, up to 30 rural community hospitals can participate. Existing hospitals can continue unless they choose to discontinue. Payment calculations for covered inpatient hospital services will be adjusted based on reasonable costs. The Rural Community Hospital Demonstration Program allows up to 30 rural community hospitals to participate for a 5-year extension period. Payment calculations for inpatient hospital services will be adjusted based on reasonable costs. The Secretary must submit reports to Congress on the Rural Community Hospital Demonstration Program, including recommendations for legislation and administrative action, at the end of the initial 5-year period and the 5-year extension period. Technical amendments are also made to the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003. The Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003 is amended to include changes in reporting requirements and subsections related to cost reporting periods. Amendments are made to subparagraphs and paragraphs within the Act.
